STEP_CD_STEROIDS.name: Trial of Corticosteroids (Crohn's)
STEP_CD_STEROIDS.description: Patient has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids, or corticosteroids are contraindicated
STEP_CD_STEROIDS.policy_text: Patient has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids, or corticosteroids are contraindicated in this patient
STEP_CD_STEROIDS.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids, or corticosteroids are contraindicated in this patient

STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.name: Trial of Conventional Systemic Therapy (Crohn's)
STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.description: Patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy for Crohn's disease (e.g., azathioprine, 6-mercaptopurine, methotrexate)
STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.policy_text: Patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy for Crohn's disease... Examples... include azathioprine, 6-mercaptopurine, or methotrexate.
STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy for Crohn's disease

EXCEPTION_BIOLOGIC_BYPASS.name: Exception: Prior Biologic Trial
EXCEPTION_BIOLOGIC_BYPASS.description: Patient has already tried at least one biologic other than the requested medication. A biosimilar of the requested biologic does not count.
EXCEPTION_BIOLOGIC_BYPASS.policy_text: An exception to the requirement... can be made if the patient has already tried at least one biologic other than the requested medication. A biosimilar of the requested biologic does not count.
EXCEPTION_BIOLOGIC_BYPASS.source_text_excerpt: An exception to the requirement... can be made if the patient has already tried at least one biologic other than the requested medication.

CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.name: Presence of Fistulas
CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.description: Patient has enterocutaneous (perianal or abdominal) or rectovaginal fistulas
CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.policy_text: Patient has enterocutaneous (perianal or abdominal) or rectovaginal fistulas
CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.source_text_excerpt: Patient has enterocutaneous (perianal or abdominal) or rectovaginal fistulas

enriched_codes.display: Fistula of vagina to large intestine

CLINICAL_CD_RESECTION.name: Ileocolonic Resection
CLINICAL_CD_RESECTION.description: Patient had ileocolonic resection (to reduce the chance of Crohn's disease recurrence)
CLINICAL_CD_RESECTION.policy_text: Patient had ileocolonic resection (to reduce the chance of Crohn's disease recurrence)

enriched_codes.display: Colectomy, partial, with removal of terminal ileum with ileocolostomy

STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.name: Trial of Traditional Systemic Agent (Psoriasis)
STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.description: Patient has tried at least one traditional systemic agent for psoriasis for at least 3 months, unless intolerant
STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.policy_text: Patient has tried at least one traditional systemic agent for psoriasis for at least 3 months, unless intolerant... Examples include methotrexate, cyclosporine, or acitretin
STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried at least one traditional systemic agent for psoriasis for at least 3 months

STEP_PSO_PUVA.name: Trial of PUVA
STEP_PSO_PUVA.description: A 3-month trial of psoralen plus ultraviolet A light (PUVA)
STEP_PSO_PUVA.policy_text: A 3-month trial of psoralen plus ultraviolet A light (PUVA) also counts.
STEP_PSO_PUVA.source_text_excerpt: A 3-month trial of psoralen plus ultraviolet A light (PUVA) also counts.

EXCEPTION_PSO_PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_OR_ORAL.name: Exception: Prior Biologic, Otezla, or Sotyktu
EXCEPTION_PSO_PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_OR_ORAL.description: Patient already had a 3-month trial or previous intolerance to at least one biologic, Otezla/Otezla XR, or Sotyktu
EXCEPTION_PSO_PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_OR_ORAL.policy_text: An exception... can be made if the patient already had a 3-month trial or previous intolerance to at least one biologic... Otezla/Otezla XR... or Sotyktu
EXCEPTION_PSO_PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_OR_ORAL.source_text_excerpt: An exception... can be made if the patient already had a 3-month trial or previous intolerance to at least one biologic... Otezla/Otezla XR... or Sotyktu

STEP_RA_DMARD.description: Patient has tried ONE conventional synthetic DMARD for at least 3 months
STEP_RA_DMARD.policy_text: Patient has tried ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) for at least 3 months

STEP_BEHCET_CONVENTIONAL.description: Patient has tried at least ONE conventional therapy (e.g., corticosteroids, immunosuppressants)
STEP_BEHCET_CONVENTIONAL.policy_text: Patient has tried at least ONE conventional therapy... Examples include systemic corticosteroids... immunosuppressants

STEP_HS_THERAPY.name: Trial of One Other Therapy (HS)
STEP_HS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one other therapy (e.g., intralesional/oral steroids, systemic antibiotics, isotretinoin)
STEP_HS_THERAPY.policy_text: Patient has tried one other therapy... Examples include intralesional or oral corticosteroids... systemic antibiotics... and isotretinoin.
STEP_HS_THERAPY.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one other therapy

CLINICAL_IMMUNO_TOX.description: Patient developed an immunotherapy-related toxicity other than hepatitis while receiving a checkpoint inhibitor
CLINICAL_IMMUNO_TOX.policy_text: According to the prescriber, patient developed an immunotherapy-related toxicity other than hepatitis... while receiving a checkpoint inhibitor

STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.description: Patient has tried one other systemic medication for this condition
STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.policy_text: Patient has tried one other systemic medication for this condition... Examples... include methotrexate, sulfasalazine, or leflunomide, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID)

STEP_SARCOIDOSIS.description: Patient has tried at least one corticosteroid AND at least one immunosuppressive medication

STEP_SPA_PERIPHERAL.name: Trial of Conventional DMARD (Peripheral SpA)
STEP_SPA_PERIPHERAL.description: Patient has arthritis primarily in the peripheral joints AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic DMARD
STEP_SPA_PERIPHERAL.policy_text: Patient has arthritis primarily in the knees, ankles, elbows, wrists, hands, and/or feet AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD)
STEP_SPA_PERIPHERAL.source_text_excerpt: Patient has arthritis primarily in the knees... AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug

CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.name: Axial SpA with Objective Inflammation
CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.description: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation (elevated CRP or sacroiliitis on MRI)
CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.policy_text: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation, defined as at least one of the following: (1) C-reactive protein elevated... OR (2) Sacroiliitis reported on magnetic resonance imaging
CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.source_text_excerpt: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation

enriched_codes.display: C reactive protein [Mass/volume] in Serum or Plasma
Magnetic resonance (eg, proton) imaging, lower extremity joint(s), without contrast material(s)

enriched_codes.display: Magnetic resonance (eg, proton) imaging, pelvis; without contrast material(s)
enriched_codes.concept_text: Sacroiliitis reported on magnetic resonance imaging

STEP_STILLS_THERAPY.name: Trial of Steroid AND DMARD (Still's)
STEP_STILLS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one corticosteroid AND one conventional synthetic DMARD (for at least 2 months or intolerant)
STEP_STILLS_THERAPY.policy_text: Patient has tried one corticosteroid; AND Patient has tried one conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) given for at least 2 months or was intolerant
STEP_STILLS_THERAPY.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one corticosteroid; AND Patient has tried one conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) given for at least 2 months

STEP_UVEITIS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one of the following therapies: periocular, intraocular, or systemic corticosteroids, or immunosuppressives

RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE_AS.name: Objective Response (AS)
RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE_AS.description: Patient experienced a beneficial clinical response assessed by at least one objective measure
RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE_AS.policy_text: When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline... Examples... include ASDAS, ASQoL, BASDAI, BASFI, BAS-G, BASMI, DFI, HAQ-S, CRP, ESR
RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE_AS.source_text_excerpt: When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response

enriched_codes.display: Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index [BASDAI]
C reactive protein [Mass/volume] in Serum or Plasma

RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE_AS.name: Subjective Response (AS)
RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE_AS.description: Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom
RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE_AS.policy_text: Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom, such as decreased pain or stiffness, or improvement in function or activities of daily living
RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE_AS.source_text_excerpt: Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

PREFERRED_PRODUCT_REQUIRED.name: Preferred Product Requirement
PREFERRED_PRODUCT_REQUIRED.description: Preferred infliximab products must be used. Preferred products are biosimilars: Inflectra (infliximab-dyyb), Avsola (infliximab-axxq), Renflexis (infliximab-abda). Remicade (reference infliximab) is non-preferred and requires trial of a preferred product first. Refer to PSM005 for the complete preferred product list.
PREFERRED_PRODUCT_REQUIRED.policy_text: This product also requires the use of preferred products before approval of a requested non-preferred infliximab intravenous product.
PREFERRED_PRODUCT_REQUIRED.source_text_excerpt: This product also requires the use of preferred products before approval of a requested non-preferred infliximab intravenous product.

GRP_RA_CONTINUATION.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis Continuation
GRP_RA_CONTINUATION.description: Missing continuation criteria group for Rheumatoid Arthritis
GRP_RA_CONTINUATION.policy_text: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets BOTH of the following (i and ii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months; AND ii. Patient meets at least ONE of the following (a or b): a) Patient experienced a beneficial clinical response when assessed by at least one objective measure; OR b) Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

GRP_UC_CONTINUATION.name: Ulcerative Colitis Continuation
GRP_UC_CONTINUATION.description: Missing continuation criteria group for Ulcerative Colitis
GRP_UC_CONTINUATION.policy_text: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets BOTH of the following (i and ii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months; AND ii. Patient meets at least ONE of the following (a or b): a) When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline; OR b) Compared with baseline, patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

GRP_BEHCET_CONTINUATION.name: Behcet's Disease Continuation
GRP_BEHCET_CONTINUATION.description: Missing continuation criteria group for Behcet's Disease
GRP_BEHCET_CONTINUATION.policy_text: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets ALL of the following (i, ii, and iii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 3 months; AND ii. When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline; AND iii. Compared with baseline, patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

PRESCRIBER_NEURO.name: Prescribed by Neurologist
PRESCRIBER_NEURO.description: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a neurologist
PRESCRIBER_NEURO.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist, dermatologist, ophthalmologist, gastroenterologist, or neurologist

SAFETY_TB_NEGATIVE.name: Tuberculosis Screening
SAFETY_TB_NEGATIVE.description: Patient must have a negative TB test (QuantiFERON-TB Gold or tuberculin skin test) prior to initiating infliximab therapy
SAFETY_TB_NEGATIVE.policy_text: Patients must be evaluated for tuberculosis (TB) risk factors and tested for latent TB infection prior to initiating therapy

clinical_codes.display: Tuberculosis test, cell mediated immunity antigen response

SAFETY_TB_NEGATIVE.source_text_excerpt: Patients must be evaluated for tuberculosis risk factors and tested for latent TB infection prior to initiating therapy

SAFETY_HEPATITIS_SCREENING.name: Hepatitis B and C Screening
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_SCREENING.description: Patient must have hepatitis B (HBsAg, anti-HBc, anti-HBs) and hepatitis C (HCV antibody) screening completed prior to initiating infliximab therapy
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_SCREENING.policy_text: Patients should be tested for hepatitis B virus infection before initiating treatment. Hepatitis C screening is also recommended prior to biologic therapy
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_SCREENING.source_text_excerpt: Patients should be tested for hepatitis B virus infection before initiating treatment

exclusions.description: This medication should not be administered in combination with another biologic or with a targeted synthetic oral small molecule drug used for an inflammatory condition

STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one other systemic medication for this condition

CLINICAL_JIA_AGGRESSIVE.source_text_excerpt: Patient has aggressive disease, as determined by the prescriber

STEP_PYODERMA_STEROID.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid

STEP_PYODERMA_IMMUNO.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one other immunosuppressant for at least 2 months

STEP_SARCOIDOSIS.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried at least one corticosteroid; AND Patient has tried at least one immunosuppressive medication

STEP_SCLERITIS.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one other therapy for this condition

STEP_SPA_PERIPHERAL.source_text_excerpt: Patient has arthritis primarily in the knees... AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug

CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.source_text_excerpt: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation

STEP_STILLS_THERAPY.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one corticosteroid; AND Patient has tried one conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) given for at least 2 months

STEP_UVEITIS_THERAPY.source_text_excerpt: Patient has tried one of the following therapies: periocular, intraocular, or systemic corticosteroids, or immunosuppressives

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_6MO.source_text_excerpt: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_3MO.source_text_excerpt: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 3 months

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_1MO.source_text_excerpt: Patient has been established on an infliximab product for at least 1 month

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_4MO.source_text_excerpt: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 4 months

RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE_AS.source_text_excerpt: When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response

RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE_AS.source_text_excerpt: Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

PREFERRED_PRODUCT_REQUIRED.source_text_excerpt: This product also requires the use of preferred products before approval of a requested non-preferred infliximab intravenous product.

GRP_RA_CONTINUATION.source_text_excerpt: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets BOTH of the following (i and ii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months; AND ii. Patient meets at least ONE of the following (a or b): a) Patient experienced a beneficial clinical response when assessed by at least one objective measure; OR b) Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

GRP_UC_CONTINUATION.source_text_excerpt: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets BOTH of the following (i and ii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months; AND ii. Patient meets at least ONE of the following (a or b): a) When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline; OR b) Compared with baseline, patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

GRP_BEHCET_CONTINUATION.source_text_excerpt: Patient is Currently Receiving an Infliximab Product. Approve for 1 year if the patient meets ALL of the following (i, ii, and iii): i. Patient has been established on therapy for at least 3 months; AND ii. When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline; AND iii. Compared with baseline, patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

PRESCRIBER_NEURO.source_text_excerpt: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist, dermatologist, ophthalmologist, gastroenterologist, or neurologist
